title: Strictly's Shirley Ballas: 'I've always preferred to stay busy. That hasn't changed with age'
text:
The Strictly Come Dancing head judge, 59, lives in south London with her rescue dog, Charlie, works seven days a week and loves Miss Marple

Life is non-stop during Strictly season. I wake up around 6.30am and meet my personal trainer for an hour of yoga, cardio or weights in the park. If I had my way, I’d train every day, but at the moment I’m lucky if I do it three times a week.

I wash my hair every morning so I can blow-dry it. I apply a little make-up, have a black coffee, and eat half an avocado with a tablespoon of tuna, lemon and salt. I’m out of the door by 9.45am.

I’ve recently been teaching world-class dancers for the International Ballroom Dancing Championships at a studio in Streatham,...
description: The Strictly Come Dancing head judge, 59, lives in south London with her rescue dog, Charlie, works seven days a week and loves Miss Marple
